storyInfo: The Gendarmerie commander saves Ebenholz's life but is killed by Witch King cultists. Federico becomes a suspect. Viviana suspects that the Witch King's remnants want to use the deaths to find the greatest secret that the Witch King left behind, the lost Genesis Horn.

attributes.content: Don't your eyes get tired, staring at a book for so long?
attributes.name: Cora

attributes.content: I'm used to it.
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: In my tournament days, my schedule was always packed. Time to myself was precious, so I often spent entire nights reading.
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: Don't feel pressured. You've only just returned to Leithanien.
attributes.name: Cora

attributes.content: Even in Kazimierz, I never forgot where my home was.
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: Over there, they called me 'The Knight from Leithanien.'
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: My Leithanian guests often discussed poetry and music from home with me, and praised me for being a paragon of 'the light of Leithanian elegance.'
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: They're not wrong.
attributes.name: Cora

attributes.content: Yet I spent most of my life away from this country.
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: (Leithanian) Other than the language, and the books I've read...
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: (Leithanian) How much do I truly know about this land?
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: Is there a pointy dome up ahead? What's the color of the tip?
attributes.name: Cora

attributes.content: White, adorned with orange.
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: It's my favorite flower shop. I can smell the flowers, but I wouldn't know if they've painted it a different color.
attributes.name: Cora

attributes.content: I envy you. You have a brand-new chance to appreciate this city, this country.
attributes.name: Cora

attributes.content: Unlike me, who's never had the opportunity to see Zwillingstürme with my own eyes.
attributes.name: Cora

attributes.content: Your eyes...
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: My sight died with the Witch King, twenty-three years ago. That's the last time I saw the city.
attributes.name: Cora

attributes.content: Unlike me, you have a chance to see the beauty of the present, and... a future that should be better.
attributes.name: Cora

attributes.content: Hello, this is Droste.
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: ...What did you say?
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: Sorry. I heard you. I just... couldn't believe what I heard.
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: Who is it?
attributes.name: Cora

attributes.content: The Gendarmerie who was a Candle Knight fan. I asked him to follow up on the art gallery incident.
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: Neither of us thought it would be a simple case.
attributes.name: Cora

attributes.content: But what I didn't expect was...
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: Loris Bordin, confirmed dead.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: Cause of death is Originium Arts trauma from at least five different sources. Direct cause of death is believed to be suffocation caused by the ribcage penetrating the lungs.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: The next step is to destroy the statue and retrieve the body.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: Statue is believed to have been created by an extremely rare form of matter reconstruction Arts, and appears to be highly resistant to damage.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: Wait up, you're too fast—
attributes.name: Serene Apprentice

attributes.content: What the hell are you doing?!
attributes.name: Serene Apprentice

attributes.content: Loris Bordin was a citizen of Laterano.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: Notarial Hall regulations dictate that I examine his body to ascertain whether he left behind an executable will.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: So you'll shoot the whole crime scene to pieces?
attributes.name: Serene Apprentice

attributes.content: I am quite accurate.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: My calculations indicate only a 27% chance that destroying the statue without damaging the body will cause a collapse.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: You can't.
attributes.name: Serene Apprentice

attributes.content: Explain.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: First of all, the Gendarmerie has the area surrounded.
attributes.name: Serene Apprentice

attributes.content: They heard the gunshots, and will be in here in three minutes.
attributes.name: Serene Apprentice

attributes.content: When they do, they'll see you, a Sankta, pointing a gun at the mutilated body of their commander.
attributes.name: Serene Apprentice

attributes.content: I'll be quick.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: I said, 'first of all'!
attributes.name: Serene Apprentice

attributes.content: More importantly, there's no way you can retrieve Bordin's body intact. His flesh is a part of the statue now. They're completely inseparable—
attributes.name: Serene Apprentice

attributes.content: Not even with your Arts?
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: You didn't seriously think a kid like me could undo the Witch King's Arts, did you?
attributes.name: Serene Apprentice

attributes.content: Over here!
attributes.name: Gendarmerie

attributes.content: It took them less than two minutes.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: You should have mentioned your second point first. If there is excessive difficulty in completing the objective, then I will delay the retrieval of Loris Bordin's body.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: My bad. I didn't think there could possibly be anyone harder to communicate with than her.
attributes.name: Serene Apprentice

attributes.content: Put down your weapon! Turn around!
attributes.name: Gendarmerie

attributes.content: We're surrounded.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: I'll count to ten, then we make a run for it.
attributes.name: Serene Apprentice

attributes.content: Your name.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: Name? Micha. Micha Wolf... Wait, now's not the time for introductions, is it?
attributes.name: Serene Apprentice

attributes.content: You're attempting to persuade me to violate the laws of Leithanien. I must reassess the logic of continuing to work with you.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: We share a common goal. I want to find Arturia too. Is that enough?
attributes.name: Micha

attributes.content: Very well.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: But this is an international matter. His Holiness would want me to—
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: The culprit won't wait for the diplomatic process to finish.
attributes.name: Micha

attributes.content: What is the count at now?
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: ...Ten. Let's just say it's ten. Go!
attributes.name: Micha

attributes.content: Frau Droste!
attributes.name: Gendarmerie

attributes.content: What's the situation, Pym?
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: The suspects fled the scene. A small Lupo with unusual Arts, and a gun-wielding Sankta. Must be the same one who broke into the art gallery.
attributes.name: Gendarmerie

attributes.content: A Sankta and a Lupo?
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: ...Is that the crime scene?
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: I wouldn't advise heading into the sewers, meine Dame... It's not a sight for the faint of heart.
attributes.name: Gendarmerie

attributes.content: Herr Bordin's footprints stretch from the entrance into this area.
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: The scent of Originium Arts... There was a big fight here.
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: A statue in the shape of the Witch King's twisted horns. Not at all how the books describe them.
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: Wait, is that...
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: Herr Bordin's face? In the middle of the statue?
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: How... how could they be so cruel?
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: ...Who's there?
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: I know you're there. Show yourself.
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: Don't worry, I'm neither Gendarmerie nor secret police.
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: I'm just mourning for Herr Bordin, like you.
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: Did you know him?
Only in passing.
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: When we first met, he reminded me of many people I've worked with in Kazimierz.
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: People who once dreamt big dreams with a burning passion. But it's a rare soul that never wavers, always shining bright like a lighthouse.
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: Most are like Herr Bordin... or myself.
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: Which makes me all the more curious. What made him decide to face such a dangerous foe by himself?
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: And... why him?
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: Why kill such an ordinary man, one already resigned to his own mediocrity?
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: But he wasn't an ordinary man!
attributes.name: Stubborn Apprentice

attributes.content: He was a hero! He came here to save lives... *sob*
attributes.name: Stubborn Apprentice

attributes.content: Do you need a handkerchief?
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: I'm sorry... I was so stupid... I'm the one who got him killed...
attributes.name: Stubborn Apprentice

attributes.content: He told me to run, so I ran. But I should've known they wouldn't let him live!
attributes.name: Stubborn Apprentice

attributes.content: Who exactly are 'they'?
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: I'm not so sure myself, all I know is that they all wear masks and call themselves the 'Echoes of Herkunftshorn.'
attributes.name: Stubborn Apprentice

attributes.content: ...The name of the Witch King.
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: I've read that his followers believe that using his name grants them his wisdom and insight, even after his death.
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: That's not just a legend! Didn't you see the statue they made from Loris's flesh? They're punishing traitors in his name!
attributes.name: Stubborn Apprentice

attributes.content: They said that the soul of the traitor will lead them to the lost Genesis Horn.
attributes.name: Stubborn Apprentice

attributes.content: The statue in the park comes alive.
It stands up, swinging its stone instrument like an executioner's axe, bringing it down on the people below.
Ah—!
attributes.name: Stubborn Apprentice

attributes.content: Look out!
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: Th-That was close... did something crush the statue?! It's so dark...
attributes.name: Stubborn Apprentice

attributes.content: ...It's nothing.
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: Just never speak that name to anyone ever again.
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: Herk... Herkun... could the legends really be true?
attributes.name: Stubborn Apprentice

attributes.content: Is it true that His Majesty isn't really dead, and that we still live under his gaze?
attributes.name: Stubborn Apprentice

attributes.content: Try to forget everything you saw and heard these past few days... other than Herr Bordin's sacrifice.
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: As an Empresses' Voice, I promise you that his death will not fade into silence.
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: Follow the light. My candle will protect you.
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: ...The lost Genesis Horn? I've heard rumors.
attributes.name: Cora

attributes.content: Before he jumped from his spire following his liege's death, the Witch King's concertmaster claimed that Herkunftshorn... that the Genesis Horn still 'stands' somewhere on this land.
attributes.name: Cora

attributes.content: At first, Their Majesties believed this to refer to the Spire of the Witch King.
attributes.name: Cora

attributes.content: But that Spire had long since been toppled.
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: Indeed. Their Majesties destroyed every brick and tile that could have contained the Witch King's Arts, and recombined them to form the bones and blood of the Twin Empresses' Spires.
attributes.name: Cora

attributes.content: The remnants believe that the Spire still exists, then?
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: Or maybe it's not a spire at all.
attributes.name: Cora

attributes.content: In Leithanien, a spire is simply a symbol of one prowess in Arts.
attributes.name: Cora

attributes.content: If your theory is correct, and there's some kind of ritual behind these deaths...
attributes.name: Cora

attributes.content: Then they must be looking for the final secret the Witch King left in this realm.
attributes.name: Cora

attributes.content: ...'Death of the Witch King.'
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: The theme of Frau Seemann's final painting.
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: The Witch King's remnants do not pick their victims at random. Perhaps the secret they're looking for has something to do with her painting.
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: Their Majesties' casters have examined all the artwork in the museum and found nothing of note.
attributes.name: Cora

attributes.content: Perhaps she left other clues in the creation process.
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: Frau Löwenstein, please proceed to Frau Seemann's residence. I'll meet you there.
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: You're going to walk the streets, just like that? Don't you know that the Gendarmerie are looking for you?
attributes.name: Micha

attributes.content: It is more efficient to find Arturia before they catch up.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: You don't even care how big of a mess you make, do you? Just don't leave the cleanup to me.
attributes.name: Micha

attributes.content: You said we shared a common goal.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: I suppose.
attributes.name: Micha

attributes.content: And you said that Arturia lured you away to target that officer.
attributes.name: Micha

attributes.content: But why? Why give him a chance to fight back if she just wanted him dead?
attributes.name: Micha

attributes.content: Is murder not enough for her? Does she enjoy watching people die in pain?
attributes.name: Micha

attributes.content: No, she takes no joy in hurting others.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: Are you sure about that? She's hanging out with the Witch King's remnants. Why would you expect her to have basic morals?
attributes.name: Micha

attributes.content: Define morals.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: Huh?
attributes.name: Micha

attributes.content: If morals are a set of behavioral rules that ensure social order, then yes, Arturia is certainly a dangerous criminal with no regard for morality.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: However, if they represent the impetus and capacity to understand and respect the emotions and experiences of another, then I have never met an individual with more morals than her.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: ...Get to the point.
attributes.name: Micha

attributes.content: Arturia did not intend to kill Loris Bordin.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: That statue was an affront to life. She would have deemed it unbearably ugly.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: What's the commotion this time? Have those ignorant peasants come to cause trouble again?
attributes.name: Old Noble Upstairs

attributes.content: Why do we give the Gendarmerie so many favors if they can't even do their jobs? Get me on the line with Bordin.
attributes.name: Old Noble Upstairs

attributes.content: What did you say? Bordin's dead?
attributes.name: Old Noble Upstairs

attributes.content: I knew the Gendarmerie were trash!
attributes.name: Old Noble Upstairs

attributes.content: This cello... not too bad. It sounds just like the one from a few days ago. No doubt this culturally rich alley has drawn the attention of a famous musician.
attributes.name: Old Noble Upstairs

attributes.content: Wings and a halo? My goodness, it's a Sankta from Laterano!
attributes.name: Old Noble Upstairs

attributes.content: I dread for the future of our dear Leithanien!
attributes.name: Old Noble Upstairs

attributes.content: This piece is dedicated to the return of the hero, Loris Bordin.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: The tune of the cello echoes through the alley.
The moment the hero of days past rediscovered his courage, his suppressed love and hatred, regret and determination, hope and despair—all are revealed by its melody.
It is the sound of mourning, of remembrance, of praise.
The life that should have faded is brought back more brilliant than ever. Brighter than the morning sun, brighter than the blooming flowers.
Frau Seemann's belongings have been sorted and laid out upstairs... Frau Löwenstein? Are you crying?
attributes.name: Noble Attendant

attributes.content: I think I'm 'seeing' memories.
attributes.name: Cora

attributes.content: Are the marigolds in the alley blooming?
attributes.name: Cora

attributes.content: Yes. This was her favorite season. She used to lean by the window, painting the passersby.
attributes.name: Noble Attendant

attributes.content: Yes, I remember.
attributes.name: Cora

attributes.content: I loved her paintings. My memories of them have never faded in color.
attributes.name: Cora

attributes.content: Those golden days, when we all lived with hope for the future...
attributes.name: Cora

attributes.content: But before you know it, it's all in the past.
attributes.name: Cora

attributes.content: Take me to Frieda's room, Anna.
attributes.name: Cora

attributes.content: Hello.
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: You're back, Frau Droste. Of all the nobles I've met, I've never known a more avid reader.
attributes.name: Spire Caster

attributes.content: I would like to access the library at the top floor.
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: The top floor? The forbidden section?
attributes.name: Spire Caster

attributes.content: I need to review the records of the forbidden research conducted by the Witch King's remnants in recent years.
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: That might be an issue...
attributes.name: Spire Caster

attributes.content: I can get Her Majesty's permission immediately, if necessary.
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: There's no need for that. Naturally, the forbidden section is open to an Empresses' Voice. However, I'm afraid that all the documents were removed this morning.
attributes.name: Spire Caster

attributes.content: ...May I ask who did it?
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: A spire caster. On Her Majesty's orders, as far as I know.
attributes.name: Spire Caster

attributes.content: But it was Her Majesty who gave me her blessing to come here...
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: As you well know, there is more than one woman who bears that title.
attributes.name: Spire Caster

attributes.content: I hope you're ready. I won't tolerate any more interruptions to the plan.
attributes.name: Grimmacht

attributes.content: Almost there. I just need these experiment notes.
You Leithanians have such awful hobbies. It's such a bother trying to sift something useful from all the chaff.
Gertrude Strollo was simply a convenient woman to set up to take the fall. Her talents were mediocre.
attributes.name: Grimmacht

attributes.content: Did you involve every noble in this? Even the ones who had secret dealings with the Victorian dukes last time?
Every one I could find.
attributes.name: Grimmacht

attributes.content: A familiar tone.
No wonder they fear you so much, Your Majesty. Do you know what they call you behind closed doors? 'The next Witch King.' I have to say, your similar taste in wardrobe does you no favors either.
I've never denied what Herkunftshorn's intelligence, skill, and strength meant to Leithanien.
attributes.name: Grimmacht

attributes.content: In fact, that's exactly what we need right now.
attributes.name: Grimmacht

attributes.content: The Kurfürsten wouldn't like the sound of that at all.
It's not the title of 'Witch King' that they fear. What they fear is Lieselotte and I walking Herkunftshorn's old path, and encroaching on their power and interests.
attributes.name: Grimmacht

attributes.content: You remind me of old Leopold. When the two of you were born, he asked me what the life expectancy of children born of the eldritch arts was.
And your answer?
attributes.name: Grimmacht

attributes.content: I said, 'I can't give you a precise answer, Your Excellency the Großherzog, but I'm sure they'll outlive you.'
I doubt he was happy to hear that.
attributes.name: Grimmacht

attributes.content: Was I wrong? He wanted to see the fall of Herkunftshorn, but forgot to take his own age into account.
Leopold participated in the Battle of the Four Emperors, and led the revolution that overthrew the Witch King. He was undoubtedly a hero of Leithanien.
attributes.name: Grimmacht

attributes.content: Heroes can be greedy too.
Greed can be forgiven, as long as they stand for a unified Leithanien.
attributes.name: Grimmacht

attributes.content: Otherwise, the greedy must be parted from their positions. Or their heads from their necks.
attributes.name: Grimmacht

attributes.content: Ruling with an iron fist, I see. But what does Ewigegnade think about that?
Lieselotte does not approve of my methods. She whispers in my ear that such radical measures only create more opposition.
attributes.name: Grimmacht

attributes.content: Hmph. She thinks herself the gentle mother.
Your words would sting her.
attributes.name: Grimmacht

attributes.content: Grimmacht, my harsh Kaiserin, it is so unsettling to see such sentimentality on your face.
Lieselotte truly loves Leithanien and its people. As such, she is destined to stand in my way.
attributes.name: Grimmacht

attributes.content: Good. Now there's the dark, brooding look I know and love.
Did you want to convince me that you'll be able to see it through when the time comes?
Many scholars believe that those born from Arts, like us, are born without a soul.
attributes.name: Grimmacht

attributes.content: Tsk.
They say the same of you. They believe that we are of the same kind.
attributes.name: Grimmacht

attributes.content: Oh? For our lack of souls, or for our cruelty?
Help me one more time, Fremont.
attributes.name: Grimmacht

attributes.content: We must find the Witch King's legacy.
attributes.name: Grimmacht

attributes.content: (Indistinct voice)
Someone... calling to me?
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: Was it... you?
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: Where's the one who saved my life?
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: Dead.
attributes.name: Stern Youth

attributes.content: I'm sorry... Once again, I've let the courage of another go to waste.
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: ...Nngh!
attributes.name: Ebenholz
Ebenholz
attributes.content: Water?

attributes.name: Ebenholz
attributes.content: You poured water on my face?
Drink.
attributes.name: Stern Youth
Ebenholz
attributes.content: You're mistaken if you think I'll simply cooper—

attributes.name: Ebenholz
attributes.content: Ugh!
If you won't drink, I'll have to take other measures.
attributes.name: Stern Youth

attributes.content: *cough* *cough* Is this... medicine? Or some novel form of torture, Herr Executioner?
attributes.name: Ebenholz

attributes.content: Dying is easy, especially for a frail, Infected noble.
attributes.name: Stern Youth

attributes.content: But you have only one chance to do it.
attributes.name: Stern Youth

attributes.content: Before you die, think carefully about how you really want to make your curtain call.
attributes.name: Stern Youth
